recommendations.title: The Artist Holding Valuable Art Hostage to Protect Julian Assange
recommendations.excerpt: Using a thirty-two-ton Swiss bank safe, Andrei Molodkin says he will destroy works by Picasso, Rembrandt, and Warhol if the WikiLeaks founder dies in prison.

recommendations.title: How to Gain Strength and Build Muscle Fast
recommendations.excerpt: Reaching your fitness goal is not always easy, but here is an expert guide to help you on your way.

recommendations.title: Beware: A Cheese Crisis Looms
recommendations.excerpt: Gird your curds! Say a prayer for Camembert! A collapse in microbe diversity puts these French cheeses at risk.

recommendations.title: VIDEO: Rio's samba schools compete for Carnival parade prize
recommendations.excerpt: Hundreds of thousands of people are lining the streets of Brazil's Rio de Janeiro to watch the world famous parades. The city's top samba schools are vying for the prize of best parade.

recommendations.title: The Hidden Injustice of Cyberattacks
recommendations.excerpt: Cyberattacks and criminal scams can impact anyone. But communities of color and other marginalized groups are often disproportionately impacted and lack the support to better protect themselves.

recommendations.title: A New Look at Our Linguistic Roots
recommendations.excerpt: Linguists and archaeologists have argued for decades about where, and when, the first Indo-European languages were spoken, and what kind of lives those first speakers led. A controversial new analytic technique offers a fresh answer.

recommendations.title: Don’t bounce back, bounce forward: how to be more resilient at every age
recommendations.excerpt: From toddlers climbing trees to retirees getting busy, experts share tips on coping well throughout life

recommendations.title: How Tech Giants Turned Ukraine Into an AI War Lab
recommendations.excerpt: AI tools provided by companies like Palantir raise questions about when and how invasive tech should be used in wartime.

recommendations.title: Your Mac Is Not Virus Proof. It Never Has Been.
recommendations.excerpt: The myth that your Mac is safe from computer viruses may have originated from Apple’s commercials in 2006, but it’s simply not true.

recommendations.title: How Two Irish Businessmen Almost Took Nigeria for $11 Billion
recommendations.excerpt: A mundane contractual provision met with rampant corruption — revealing a serious vulnerability in one of the backbones of international commerce.

recommendations.title: Across the World, Migrating Animal Populations Are Dwindling. Here’s Why
recommendations.excerpt: In a landmark U.N. study, researchers found nearly half of the world's threatened migratory species have declining populations. More than a fifth of the assessed animals face extinction.

recommendations.title: The Slack Generation Can’t Communicate With the Email Generation. Why More Platforms Are Dividing the Workplace
recommendations.excerpt: Workplace miscommunication and conflict are on the rise, as work becomes more decentralized and multigenerational.

recommendations.title: How to Get Rid of Drain Flies Permanently
recommendations.excerpt: Kick out those shower- and sink-loving insects before they get out of hand.

recommendations.title: How Electric Lighting Changed Our Sleep, and Other Stories in Materials Science
recommendations.excerpt: Author and science evangelist Ainissa Ramirez discusses her book, ‘The Alchemy of Us.’

recommendations.title: How a Professional Dungeon Master Keeps His Games Fun
recommendations.excerpt: Why Dungeons & Dragons newbies trust DM Timm Woods to guide them through the game.

recommendations.title: Why Do Birds Have Such Skinny Legs?
recommendations.excerpt: The songbirds in your backyard hop around on such itty-bitty legs. Here’s why bird legs are so skinny and how they can support a bird’s weight

recommendations.title: How to Reboot After Disappointment at Work
recommendations.excerpt: We can bounce back better from a disappointment if we pay more attention to our internal dialogue.

recommendations.title: The Mysterious Origins of Peru’s Oldest Indigenous People
recommendations.excerpt: The indigenous Uros people of Lake Titicaca live on floating islands made from reeds. How did they get there?

recommendations.title: How to Keep Your Creativity Alive When You Have a Chronic Illness
recommendations.excerpt: If making things is part of your identity, it can feel awful when your symptoms get in the way.

recommendations.title: AUDIO: The Dark Side of the Internet’s Obsession With Anxiety
recommendations.excerpt: Clinical psychologist Darby Saxbe joins the show to dive into the way we talk about anxiety on the internet and what good mental health conversations might look like.

recommendations.title: The Afterlife of the Male Model
recommendations.excerpt: What happens to young men when they quit the modeling industry? Some exit the business gracefully, some take a nose dive, some find salvation at the Cheesecake Factory.

recommendations.title: 12 Low-Maintenance Houseplants Even Beginners Can Keep Alive
recommendations.excerpt: If you have a limited amount of space and sunlight — and even more limited experience — you can still reap the benefits of houseplants.

recommendations.title: The Unsettling Scourge of Obituary Spam
recommendations.excerpt: In the wake of death, AI-generated obituaries litter search results, turning even private individuals into clickbait.

recommendations.title: How a Nuclear Weapons Lab Helped Crack a Serial-Killer Case
recommendations.excerpt: A prominent forensic science center played a crucial role in helping to solve a notorious 1990s murder case.

recommendations.title: Your unique smell can provide clues about how healthy you are
recommendations.excerpt: The science of smell is an exciting area of research.

recommendations.title: The World’s 15 Most Romantic Hotels
recommendations.excerpt: These retreats around the world offer a dreamy setting for your next romantic getaway.

recommendations.title: Six Tips for Loving Your Enemies
recommendations.excerpt: Choosing love over hate can be difficult, but ultimately it may be the path to healing for ourselves and our society.

recommendations.title: The Best Video Games to Play After a Breakup
recommendations.excerpt: Now the video game backlog is sitting there, gleaming with potential.

recommendations.title: How cute became the defining aesthetic of the internet age
recommendations.excerpt: From emojis to coquettes and Hello Kitty, cute’s transformative potential is shaping how we see ourselves both on and off-screen.

recommendations.title: The Tiny Ant and the Mighty Lion
recommendations.excerpt: How one insect is reshaping the ecosystem of the African savannah.
